open_drawer close_drawer Do you want to complete MSOT now? Do you want to continue Branch MSOT? Do you want to continue Technician MSOT?
Yes No N/A Partial Remarks:
Ladder Use(a) (LU) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 4 Is ladder being used? 4(a) Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 4(b) Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 4(c) Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 4(d) User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? Next
Fly Killer Dispenser installation / servicing(b) (FKDIS) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 5.Activities observed involved Air Freshener (AF) / Fly Killer Dispenser Unit? Is ladder being used? 5(a) Air-freshener/ Fly Killer Dispenser Units are installed not more than 2 meter above the ground. 5(b) For installations above 2m, SRA is done with safe work method in place? Supervisor, manager or SHE person is consulted? 5(c) Air Freshener or Fly Killer units are not installed directly above areas with human traffic/ activities, to minimize risks of hit by falling units. 4.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 5.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 6.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 7.User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? Submit
Bait Stations Installation / Servicing (WAH) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 6.Activities observed involved Bait Stations and Fly Traps installation/ servicing? 6(a) Bait Stations/ Fly Traps are not installed at height where the access is unsafe or obstructed (falling from height hazards). 2. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe to access locations, that avoid/ minimize slip , trip and fall risks? 3. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe locations away from moving vehicles, moving machinery and electrical hazards? Submit
Fly Traps Installation / Servicing (FTIS) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Activities observed involved Bait Stations and Fly Traps installation/ servicing? 1. Bait Stations/ Fly Traps are not installed at height where the access is unsafe or obstructed (falling from height hazards) 2. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe to access locations, that avoid/ minimize slip , trip and fall risks? 3. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe locations away from moving vehicles, moving machinery and electrical hazards? Submit
Bird Proofing Via Abseiling (BPVA) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 7.Activities observed involved Bird Proofing? 7(a) Is Personal Fall Arrest System (PFAS including harness, lifeline, connectors) inspected before use? 7(b) Is Rescue kit (for abseiling/ rope access) available as technician carried out bird proofing? 7(c) Is a Rescuer wearing full body harness on standby during bird proofing work? Submit
Driving Service Vehicle (DSV) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Staff drives a vehicle or rides a motorbike for work? 1. Staff has a valid driving license? Request to see license for verification 2. Staff (driving the vehicle) is the authorized driver appointed by RI to drive this vehicle? 3. Staff has the Company Vehicle Handbook and been briefed by his supervisor/ manager/ SHE personnel? 4. Is service vehicle in good condition? Take picture of vehicle and the license plate. 5.Seat belts easily accessible and in good condition? Take a picture 6.Service vehicle (4-wheeler) equipped with emergency equipment and these are in good conditions? Submit
Riding Motorbike For Work (RMW) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Staff drives a vehicle or rides a motorbike for work? 1. Staff has a valid driving license? Request to see license for verification 2. Staff (driving the vehicle) is the authorized driver appointed by RI to drive this vehicle? 3. Staff has the Company Vehicle Handbook and been briefed by his supervisor/ manager/ SHE personnel? 4. Is service vehicle in good condition? Take picture of vehicle and the license plate. 5.Seat belts easily accessible and in good condition? Take a picture
Submit
Work At The Ceiling/ Roof Void (WCRV) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Is ladder being used? 1.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 2.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 3.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 4. User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? 5. If there is work at the ceiling/ roof void, has technician check if there are electrical fittings/ cables at the ceiling space/ roof void? 6. If there are electrical cables/ fittings at the ceiling/ roof void, has staff discuss with customer to turn off the power to these electricals before start work? 7. If not practicable to shut down power to the electricals at the ceiling/ roof void, other safe alternatives have been adopted? 8. Electrical insulation gloves used by staff are in good condition? Submit
Entry into Roof Void (ERV) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Is ladder being used? 1.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 2.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 3.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 4. User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? 5. If there is work at the ceiling/ roof void, has technician check if there are electrical fittings/ cables at the ceiling space/ roof void? 6. If there are electrical cables/ fittings at the ceiling/ roof void, has staff discuss with customer to turn off the power to these electricals before start work? 7. If not practicable to shut down power to the electricals at the ceiling/ roof void, other safe alternatives have been adopted? 8. Electrical insulation gloves used by staff are in good condition? Submit
Insect Light Trap (ILT) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Is ladder being used? Insect light traps are unplugged from the power point prior to servicing? (as per Pink Note 9) 1.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 2.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 3.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 4. User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? Submit
Work Near / Around Electrical Cabinet (WNEC) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 1. High voltage electrical cabinet or room is clearly labelled (e.g. Danger - High Voltage), and securely enclosed. 2. Staff does not access and open any operating high voltage electrical panel. 3. A minimum safe distance of 3m is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding (e.g. hand phone) and any suspected or exposed live high voltage electrical part. 4. A minimum safe distance - Arms Length is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding and any suspected or exposed live low voltage electrical part. Submit
Work Inside Electrical Room (WIER) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 1. High voltage electrical cabinet or room is clearly labelled (e.g. Danger - High Voltage), and securely enclosed. 2. Staff does not access and open any operating high voltage electrical panel. 3. A minimum safe distance of 3m is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding (e.g. hand phone) and any suspected or exposed live high voltage electrical part. 4. A minimum safe distance - Arms Length is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding and any suspected or exposed live low voltage electrical part. Submit
FUMIGATION SAFETY (FS) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) 1.Is fumigation work being carried out? Please indicate the item or area to be fumigated below: Please indicate the fumigant used : Methyl Bromide Phosphide Hydrogen Cyanide Carbon Dioxide Ethylene Oxide 2.Can fumigator explain the five Fumigation golden rules? 3.Fumigator is trained and licensed to do fumigation? Take picture of the fumigator’s license if available. 4.RPE (Respiratory Protection Equipment) is used during fumigation, and is regularly inspected. 5.Suitable Gas detector is available, used and been regularly inspected, calibrated? Submit
Air Freshener (AF) Installation / Servicing (AF) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Activities observed involved Air Freshener (AF) / Fly Killer Dispenser Unit? Is ladder being used? 1. Air-freshener/ Fly Killer Dispenser Units are installed not more than 2 meter above the ground. 2. For installations above 2m, SRA is done with safe work method in place? Supervisor, manager or SHE person is consulted? 3. AF or Fly Killer units are not installed directly above areas with human traffic/ activities, to minimize risks of hit by falling units 4.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 5.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 6.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 7. User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? Submit
Scenting (SC) Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Is ladder being used? 1.Ladder is of the right height (top 2 rungs must not be in use) and in good condition? 2.Ladder has Safe Working Load (SWL) label e.g. SWL 150kg? 3.Ladder is stable, on even ground and can be fully spread out (for A-ladder)? 4. User has 3 points of contact with the ladder and has the front of his body facing the ladder? 5. If there is work at the ceiling/ roof void, has technician check if there are electrical fittings/ cables at the ceiling space/ roof void? 6. If there are electrical cables/ fittings at the ceiling/ roof void, has staff discuss with customer to turn off the power to these electricals before start work? 7. If not practicable to shut down power to the electricals at the ceiling/ roof void, other safe alternatives have been adopted? 8. Electrical insulation gloves used by staff are in good condition? Submit
WORKING AT HEIGHT (WAH) SLIP, TRIP & FALL, MOVING VEHICLE & OTHER RISKS EMPLOYEE INDUCTION & CONSULTATION
1.Activities observed involved work at height? 2.Has staff been trained on the work at height? Take picture of staff’s WAH Training ID Card if available. 3.Has staff considered other safer way before working at height?
1.Staff completed SHE Induction Training by his reporting manager / SHE personnel when first joined RI? 2.Consultation with Employee ~ Any SHE concern in your work or area of improvements to suggest for your work?

BACK Số điện thoại liên hệ Số điện thoại liên hệ: Tiến hành vào Chuẩn bị bởi Báo cáo cho Địa điểm Phát hiện/Hành động Hình ảnh Kiến nghị Tóm tắt Trang tiêu đề Tiêu đề tên khách hàng Báo cáo Ngày Id tài liệu Xem PDF Nhấn vào đây để chỉnh sửa Địa chỉ/Vị trí Nhập hoặc xác định địa chỉ của bạn Trở lại KẾ TIẾP KIỂM TRA Trước(-) Thêm(+) Khu vực Chữ ký Thêm hình ảnh Tên người đánh giá Gửi đi Chữ ký của Người đánh giá Năm nay :- Trong tiến trình Đã hoàn thành Tháng này :- Tuần này :- TÊN E-mail Chi nhánh Quốc gia ĐĂNG XUẤT Làm mới Phiên bản Không: bảng điều khiển Đồng bộ hóa Kiểm toán Báo cáo Xem / Chia sẻ Về Rentokil Kiểm tra cập nhật Ngày kiểm tra Trạng thái Đăng xuất Có Không Trang Chủ TRANG TIÊU ĐỀ CHỮ KÝ TRANG QUAN SÁT Bạn có muốn đăng xuất không? Các bộ phận của công ty hoạt động dưới ba thương hiệu toàn cầu: Rentokil, Initial và Ambius. chẳng hạn như Western Exterminator Báo cáo kiểm tra PCI (Phần 1/3) Báo cáo kiểm tra PCI (Phần 2/3) Báo cáo kiểm tra PCI (Phần 3/3)
Xóa Lưu HỦY EDIT 1. Staff knows what to report and who to report to? rAuditor Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Next 2. Witness/ encounter any near miss,injury or illness in the last 1 year? SINA CARD (Success is No Accident) INCIDENT REPORTING SECTION - A SECTION - B Management Safety Observation Tour (MSOT) Is this Section applicable? 1.Staff carried “SINA card” with him & it is in good condition? 2. Back of “SINA Card” is completed & info. remain accurate? 3. Staff is able to explain purpose of the SINA card? ZERO TOLERANCE POLICY SECTION - C Is this Section applicable? 1. Can staff explain the Zero Tolerance Policy (ZTP)? 2. Is staff aware of the disciplinary actions for ZTP non-compliance? 3. Is staff in compliance to Zero Tolerance Policy in the following areas? a) SRA done for the site? (check SRA Report / SRA App/ SRA on Service Docket/ PDA) b) SRA info have been read by Technician? c) Wear safety shoes. d) Seat belt worn by driver and passenger. e) No hand-held hand phone use while driving a vehicle or motorbike. f) No use of hand phone while operating tools and equipment. g) Wear helmet, jacket and gloves while riding motorbike/ electric bike. The PPE are in good condition. h) Respirator with cartridge filter of good condition is worn and worn properly. SHE GOLDEN RULES SECTION - D 1. Staff has the “SHE Golden Rules Booklet”? 2. Can staff explain the Start / Stop golden rules? 3. Staff complies with the Start/ Stop golden rules at work? 4. Can staff explain the Working At Height golden rules? 5. If staff drives a vehicle or ride motorbike for work, can he explain the five Driving At Work golden rules? SECTION - E SLIP, TRIP & FALL, MOVING VEHICLE & OTHER RISKS SECTION - F 1. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe to access locations, that avoid/ minimize slip, trip and fall risks? 2. Are bait stations, fly traps installed at safe distance from moving vehicles, moving machinery and electrical hazards? 3. Is staff exposed to “moving vehicles” hazards on the site? 4. Staff used high visibility vest and safety cones while loading/ unloading or doing preparation work at/ near service vehicle? 5. Staff wore high visibility vest while doing service in areas with moving vehicles e.g. loading bay, carpark, warehouse with forklift? 6. Is technician/ staff wearing high visibility vest during night work, while travelling at night or while working in dark areas? DRIVING SAFETY SECTION - G Are you sure want to save & exit? Are you sure want to delete this image? 1.Staff drives a vehicle or rides a motorbike for work? 2.Staff has a valid driving license? Request to see license for verification. 3.Staff (driving the vehicle) is the authorized driver appointed by RI to drive this vehicle? 4.Staff has the Company Vehicle Handbook and been briefed by his supervisor/ manager/ SHE personnel? 5.Is service vehicle in good condition? Take picture of vehicle and the license plate. 6.Seat belts easily accessible and in good condition? Take a picture. 1.Is the branch undertaking SRA (Site Risk Assessment)? Sample check 3 SRA reports from the branch.
